meanings.definition: A place where animals live or hide.
meanings.sent1: The bear found a cozy dens in the forest to hibernate.
meanings.sent2: The fox built its dens under a pile of rocks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's dens was so well-hidden, even the birds couldn't find it.
meanings.sent4: The dens of the rabbits were like tiny underground cities.
meanings.sent5: The dens of the wolves echoed with their howls at night.

meanings.definition: A thick growth of trees or shrubs.
meanings.sent1: The dense dens of the jungle made it hard to see through.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with lush dens of greenery.
meanings.sent3: The dens of the bushes were so thick, even the sunlight couldn't penetrate them.
meanings.sent4: The dens of the trees formed a natural barrier against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dens of the plants created a cool, shaded oasis in the hot sun.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for the opacity of a photographic negative.
meanings.sent1: The photographer adjusted the exposure to get the right dens for the image.
meanings.sent2: The dens of the film determined the quality of the final print.
meanings.sent3: The dens of the negative were crucial for developing a clear picture.
meanings.sent4: The dens of the film affected the brightness and contrast of the photograph.
meanings.sent5: The dens of the negative were too high, resulting in an overexposed image.
